content.description:
I don't know the info on this climb, but I wanted to put it on MP to hopefully find out the FA and rating. Sam Miller guessed 12b in the comments. I thought it felt closer to 11d/12a so it get's a 12- for now. Burly moves straight off the ground. I would suggest a stick clip to protect the first couple moves. After the nice jug at the end of the roof there is still some tricky moves getting up the wall above.

The last 20 feet or so are pointless 5.6 climbing over dirt and bushes. The anchors should really be at the second to last bolt where the interesting climbing ends.
content.location: The first bolted route on the far left side of the wall. It starts under a big roof.

content.description: Variation that starts on Pilled Out.  Clip the first two bolts on Pilled Out, then step up and slightly left.  Go straight up to the anchor on Battalion of Saints.
content.protection: First two bolts on Pilled Out, then cams (#1 TCU through #3 Camalot, single set).
content.location: Start on Pilled Out.  Variation that takes advantage of the other fine routes in this area.  Fun diversion.

content.description: Great climbing with a fun start. Big holds above the second bolt. Ground fall possible clipping second bolt. This bolt could easily be stick clipped.
content.location: This is the third climb from the right side of the wall.  It starts on the arete to the right of the big roof.

content.description: Great climbing with lots of good holds.
content.location: This is the far left climb.  Starts near a small bush at the base of the cliff.

climbs.name: Beef Master
climbs.fa: Deanna Caladine, Luke D, Greg M.

content.description: This one is funky getting off the ground.  Crux is between the fifth and sixth bolt.
content.location: Second climb from the right side.

content.description: Climbs over a few small bulges. The holds are all there. This is the best one in the area. A must do.
content.location: This one is the fourth line from the right side.  It climbs the bulge.  You can't miss it.

content.description: Step up and get established in the bomb bay chimney slot, stem up using cracks for pro.  Go through intial roof, then low angle short ramp to second roof.  Configure a belay atop the wall (no fixed anchor...yet).  We traversed over to the anchor on Battalion of Saints (placed pro enroute) to descend.
content.protection: Standard rack of cams (to 3 Camalot) and nuts.  Long sling for girth hitchin' Bat Boy's guano.
content.location: Around 45 feet left of Battalion of Saints.  Bomb bay chimney slot.  Belay at the bottom of the lower angle ramp.
